G93407-d-07-04-93-GWWR.Narrative: ON THE MORNING OF 7/4/1993, THE EAST ST. LOUIS 11:00PM YARD JOB Y-115 ENGINE GWWR 1502, SWITCHED A BOX CAR, CN 416258, TO TRACK 29 B-YARD, SWITCHED TWO CARS TO TRACK 28 B-YARD. THE ENGINE CAME OUT OFTRACK 28 LITE AND WAS GOING TO TRACK 30 WHEN CN 416258 ROLLED OUT OF TRACK 29. THE ENGINEER ATTEMPTED TO STOP THE ENGINE AND BACK UP BUT THE CAR STRUCK THE FRONT SIDE OF THE ENGINE AND WAS PULLED INTOA TANK CAR ON 28 TRACK. (TANK CAR UTLX 67837 WAS EMPTY AND LAST CONTAINED PLASTIC RESIN) INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT WHEN CN 416258 WAS SWITCHED TO TRACK 29, THE BRAKEMAN, MR. ANTKOWIAK, PLACED CHOCKS SEVERAL FEET IN FRONT OF THECAR INSTEAD OF UNDER THE WHEELS. WHEN THE CAR ROLLED, IT GAINED ENOUGHMOMENTUM TO RUN OVER THE CHOCKS AND INTO THE SIDE OF THE LOCOMOTIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
